DOC.HEAD: Thomson Newspapers Announces Management Changes
DOC.TEXT: Thomson Newspapers Corp. announced Wednesday a series of management changes effective Jan. 1. Kerry Lambie, 50, becomes executive vice president for operations, assuming responsiblity for newspaper operations in Canada and the United States. He will remain in Toronto. Frank Miles, 64, becomes executive vice president for acquisitions, which includes effecting and integrating acquisitions. He remains in Chicago. Lambie and Miles will report to Michael Johnston, president and chief operating officer of Thomson Newspapers Corp., a subsidiary of Thomson Corp. of Toronto Michael Sheppard, 40, replaces Lambie as senior vice president and general manager for Canada. He will move to Toronto from Chicago. D.P. Hicks, 55, replaces Miles as senior vice president and general manager for the United States. In other appointments, Allan Weir, 47, joins the company as director of human resources. R.J. Hogg, 55, moves to director of marketing from circulation director and Charles Wilson, 41, previously manager of administration, becomes director of administration. Thomson Newspapers publishes 41 daily and 19 non-daily newspapers in Canada, 117 daily and 25 non-daily newspapers in the United States, and several special-subject publications in both countries.
